Text: Grrrrrrr!!!
Woooooo!!!
...*inhales*...
Uwaaaghh!!!
...Hup.
Gyaahhh!!!
...Whew.

U-Ughh... Boss man...you're so strong at arm
wrestling!
You still have much more training to do.
Ha-ruff! I've been working hard every day!
(That's probably true.)

(Honestly, it was a struggle to breathe until the
end. Delta's inhuman strength has increased
significantly.)

(Well, if I had gone all out for even a second,
the outcome would've been instantaneous.)

(Holding back my true power and keeping a cool face
while kicking the crap out of my opponents... That's
a standard power move of a true shadowbroker, isn't
it?)

Besides, splitting another table in half would be
troublesome...
Boss man?
Hmm? Oh, it's nothing, Delta.

So, what brought you here today? I don't believe
you're the one assigned to me this week.

Did you come all this way to challenge me to an
arm wrestling match? Or, is this another runaway
situation―
Oh! That's right! I'm here for a reason!
You forgot until just now...?!
Boss man! How do I defeat a dragon?
Dragon... Defeat a dragon?

Haha, Delta! You're planning on defeating the Mist
Dragon before me, aren't you?

Well, um...I want to do that too, but first, Lady
Alpha told me to defeat another dragon!

(So, that's how it is... Well, a therianthrope's
strength is their power, so it's only natural
they'd come to that conclusion.)
And who's this other dragon?
Um... This one!
Hmm...

(...Not exactly what I expected. A plump, wide-eyed
dragon...)

(Neither an end boss, nor a secret boss, but not
just a side enemy either.)

(On the whole, it feels like a formidable foe
instead of something just for show. It's the
kind of dragon you'd sort of expect to see...!)

Gamma couldn't defeat this one, so I'm gonna go
defeat it!

Gamma? Then, the dragon part of that story... I see,
mixing reality into the setting for authenticity,
huh?

I'll defeat this one and become a dragon slayer! But
Lady Alpha said it's not just a matter of simply
defeating it.
So, I thought you'd know how to do it!
I see...

(Even "Boss man" doesn't know everything. I, for
one, would love to know how to kill a dragon
completely.)
Please, Boss man!
Ulp...

(Aah, those sparkling eyes... Just like a puppy
begging for a treat.)

...Alright. I'll teach you something important for
slaying dragons in the future.
Really?! Yay! You're the best, Boss man!
Aah, alright, alright! Stay!
Stay! Got it!

...I noticed this during our arm wrestling earlier,
but have you been repeating the same workout?
I have! Is that...bad?

I've been doing my "workout" just like you
instructed me to...

It's essential to repeatedly work out the same
muscle groups, but it's not beneficial to always
stick to the same training routine.

This is because the strength of your muscles will
adapt specifically to your regular workout load.

The goal of working out isn't just to excel at the
exercises themselves. It's about winning future
battles. Don't mistake its purpose!
U-Umm...right?!
Err...

In short, the objective of a workout isn't just to
train the same muscles using the same training
methods―

(...Am I going to spend the whole day teaching Delta
about working out...?!)

(The power of strength alone can't match the power
generated by magic. That's an absolute law in this
world.)

(So then, why is strength even necessary? It's
because physical strength is the foundation for
converting magic into swordsmanship.)

(In other words, muscles are crucial! We must never
underestimate them! Where swords may fail, muscles
won't! Even Delta should be able to grasp this!)
(I hope she'll be able to...because...!)
That's right... Muscles never let you down!
Muscle...?

If you train properly, you can even store your
muscles!

Ohh! Muscles! Muscles! I wanna store my muscles as
well!
